text.text:
Nice fun, enjoy with your kids and family. It's mix of fun and fitness.

Th beauty of this game is it will ensure how fit we are.

Avoid mid noon, and no water provided, but you can take a break and one out and have water and can join again.

Average fare is 30 SagD for one hour and must come in swim attire (decathlon shirt and slim fit sports T shirt also ok.

Overall it's a good fun.

text.text:
Lucky for us we came before the rain. Check the weather before coming! It was not sunny for a 10am slot.

Great for team bonding and fun challenging activities.

Careful as you might get abrasion so be really careful when moving around the inflatables.

Try not to wear spectacles as they will be find for you if it drops. It should be fine even if you wear spectacles, just need to be cautious.

Nearby 1 min walk is the Palawan toilet so itâ€™s easy to shower after the activity.

There were 4 lifeguards within the hydrodash. 1 or 2 were enthusiastic and engagingâ€¦ the others were like sloths just chilling by the beach! Hahaha

text.text:
HydroDash in at Sentosa, palawan Beach. It is a fantastic floating aqua park!:

* It's a fun, inflatable obstacle course suitable for ages 6 and up. Age 6 needs parent accompany.
* Expect thrills, spills, and lots of laughs.
* They have a variety of obstacles, with differing difficulty.
* It is located at Palawan beach, Sentosa.
* It is a great place for families and friends.
* Be prepared to get wet, and have a good workout.

Bring wet shoes

Essentially, if you're looking for a fun and active water activity in Singapore, HydroDash is a great option.

text.text: Safety was compromised with overloading of kids at each obstacle, safety guards did not do a proper job of crowd control and each obstacle. On top of that, there were barely enough ladders/steps at every obstacle, so when you fall into the waters, it is very difficult to climb back onto the play area. To be clear, I believe the guards tried their best to help but it was simply a lack of training from management. Management should ensure the guards are well-trained and well-informed.

originalText.text: Safety was compromised with overloading of kids at each obstacle, safety guards did not do a proper job of crowd control and each obstacle. On top of that, there were barely enough ladders/steps at every obstacle, so when you fall into the waters, it is very difficult to climb back onto the play area. To be clear, I believe the guards tried their best to help but it was simply a lack of training from management. Management should ensure the guards are well-trained and well-informed.

text.text:
Try purchasing the tickets in advance so once youâ€™re there you can simply collect tickets and go! The course itself is only fun when youâ€™re with friends or family & perfect for a hot day. I would recommend getting the 1 hour ticket as 2 hours may be repetitive as the course is not too large.

However, in my opinion I feel the course can be dangerous and youâ€™ll be prone to many cuts (especially since itâ€™s meant to be slippery). You have to be careful when running cuz I always get some cuts but never notice until after I change ðŸ˜­.

There is a 7/11 nearby for snacks and water which is a must especially in Singapore weather
